sentence.Network_en: We are prepared to fight for every inch of territory.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们时刻准备着为每一寸领土而战。

sentence.Network_en: His life was saved by a quarter-inch-thick bullet-proof steel screen.
sentence.Network_cn: 多亏一块1/4英寸厚的防弹钢板，他才捡了条命。

sentence.Network_en: The bullet had passed less than an inch from Andrea's heart.
sentence.Network_cn: 子弹在离安德烈亚的心脏不到一英寸的地方穿过。

jx.jx_en_mean: very slowly and gradually; bit by bit

phrase.cizu_name: give someone an inch and he (或 she) will take a mi

phrase.cizu_name: (to) within an inch of one's life

lj.lj_ls: “哈，在每个方面都称职的国王！”(&b{莎士比亚})

lj.lj_ly: came within an inch of death.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English ynce, from Latin uncia 'twelfth part', from unus 'one' (probably denoting a unit). Compare with ounce
Middle English: from Scottish Gaelic innis

entry.def: An inch is an imperial unit of length, approximately equal to 2.54 centimetres. There are twelve inches in a foot.

example.ex: ...a candy tin 6 inches high and 8 inches in diameter.
example.tran: 高 6 英寸、直径 8 英寸的糖果罐子

entry.def: To inch somewhere or to inch something somewhere means to move there very slowly and carefully, or to make something do this.

example.ex: ...a climber inching up a vertical wall of rock...
example.tran: 沿一面陡直石壁慢慢往上爬的人
他一点点向前挪动着货车。

entry.tran: (某个地方的)全部，每一寸地方
entry.def: If you talk about every inch of an area, you are emphasizing that you mean the whole of it.

example.ex: Every inch of shelf space was crammed with books...
We are prepared to fight for every inch of territory.
example.tran: 我们时刻准备着为每一寸领土而战。

entry.def: If you say that someone looks every inch a certain type of person, you are emphasizing that they look exactly like that kind of person.

example.ex: He looks every inch the City businessman...
example.tran: 他完全是一副伦敦金融城商界人士的派头。

example.ex: There stood Gertrude, looking every inch a star.
example.tran: 格特鲁德站在那里,完全是一副明星的派头。

entry.def: If someone or something moves inch by inch, they move very slowly and carefully.

example.ex: The car moved forward inch by inch...
example.tran: 汽车一点一点地向前移动。

example.ex: The police were searching the area inch by inch.
example.tran: 警方在对那个地区进行仔细搜查。

means.word_mean: 1. a unit of length equal to one twelfth of a foot
2. a unit of measurement for advertising space
1. advance slowly, as if by inches;

auth_sentence.content: It's every inch the equal of its predecessor.

auth_sentence.res_content: When Marri returned, he found a thirty-two-inch-screen television.

means.word_mean: 英寸（相当于 2.54 厘米，一英尺有 12 英寸）

sentences.en: Twelve inches is equal to one foot.

jushi.english: He knows every inch of the land here.
jushi.chinese: 他对这里的土地了如指掌。

jushi.english: Snowfall averages out in this part of the country at twenty inches a year.
jushi.chinese: 我国这个地区每年的平均降雪量为20英寸。

jushi.english: They couldn't see an inch before them in the dark.
jushi.chinese: 在黑暗中,他们一点儿也看不见前边。
